Notes on how this works

The code from viget.com uses Babel, which in turn relies on JSX:

  • https://reactjs.org/docs/introducing-jsx.html
  • https://reactjs.org/docs/add-react-to-a-website.html

DONE To make this work properly, it would be better to have more plain javascript that creates the event handler to change the span class to make the effect. (I made some not great, but very plain Javascript that does it.)

FIXED Also it seems to not handle the fact that it shouldn’t follow the anchor link to the top of the page. Don’t know how to fix this. Used #! as href instead of #.

EVEN BETTER FIX remove href from <a> tag altogether and use CSS to add mouse: pointer; for :hover.

Best way to start from scratch: go and read through this: MDN: Introduction to Events

Also I changed it to use a div instead of a span. Should go look up what the essential difference is there (but it allowed me to embed an iframe for YouTube, which is something Katrina wanted.)

DONE Another cool idea would be a button that expands / collapses all footnotes. (Similar to the Spotify loader) Truly some of the worst code I’ve written, but it works.

The better way to do this would be to make a state machine and allow the various inputs to change the state (either for an individual footnote or for all of them). But I don’t know how to pass a variable to the event handler function, so it is what it is.
